NFTs are unique representations of real-world assets (for example, trading cards), made ownable and tradable using blockchain technology. In the case of Cricket, the NFTs range from cricketing moments to player images.

No, they are 2 completely different things. Cricket NFTs are tradable online, but they are not a form of currency, and are instead a product bought and sold like traditional memorabilia. The only real similarity is that they both use blockchain technology.

Currently all Rario NFTs can be purchased on their marketplace in packs just like traditional trading cards. You can purchase them on the Rario Marketplace, a platform where you can buy, trade and sell your Rario NFTs to build up your collection of favourite cricketing moments from the history of the game or own the complete set of cards of your favourite players which can be used in the Play 2 Earn game.
There will be a range of different NFT series at various price points.

sectionContents.title: What determines the worth of cricket NFTs?

content.value: Like trading cards NFTs will generally be valued based on the demand (popularity) and supply (scarcity of the moment), so ultimately value is determined by market demand.

sectionContents.title: What cricket range does Rario currently produce?

content.value: Rario produces NFT series for the Hero Caribbean Premier League, Lanka Premier League, Abu Dhabi T10 League, Legends League Cricket, and Lanka Premier League. The brand also has a roster of over 1000 international cricketers as well as over 19+ exclusive brand ambassadors like Rishabh Pant, Virender Sehwag, Rashid Khan, Aaron Finch, Faf Du Plessis, Jason Holder and many more.

sectionContents.title: Which cricket boards have officially partnered with Rario?

content.value: Cricket Australia and New Zealand Cricket boards have officially partnered with Rario to launch exclusive Cricket NFT Program. Through this association Rario will also be producing Cricket NFTs for Big Bash League, Women's Big Bash League, and Super Smash.

Rario, Cricket Australia and the Australian Cricketers' Association are committed to a partnership that sees NFTs produced in a sustainable manner. For example, Rario uses Polygon blockchain, an Ethereum compatible side-chain, to mint NFTs. This translates to more eco-friendliness and considerably fewer carbon emissions.
